page.title: 17INDUSTRY
page.content: In our school out of 306 children 28 Dads and 15 Mums work in industry. There are 2 main factories in Alford. Both are situated near the town centre. Both have been there about 25 years.{British Textiles}has the most employees with a total of 110 women and 20 men employed. This particular factory makes jumpers, cardigans and other woolen and courtelle goods. These are exported all over Europe. {C.S.Martins}employs 110 people with 105 men and 5 women. The company uses steel and cast iron to make components for tractors, cars, lorries and diesel engines which are exported across the world to places like{Mitchigon U.S.A. and{Bordeaux France.}British Textiles is open on average seven hours a day whereas C.S.Martins opens eleven and a half hours a day working shifts.
